text: Hi has any of you ever tried to set HubSpot form values via jquery?
nvm I found my answer

Hi all, just a heads up that we now have a toggle in the new modules editor to make a module available for new templates. Toggled off, and developers won't be able to add a module that you're working on to any templates until you toggle it back on.
Hi everyone. Is there a way to see template revisions in the new design manager?
Ah nevermind, I found it!

<@U87NGNETZ> Can we get a toggle that does the same thing so we can say whether we want a template to be available to the end user in the portal? We use to have this ability intermittently I believe in the past. I see 2 use cases for this:
1) If we are working on a template and don't want it to appear as usable by the HubSpot user yet.
2) To clean up what templates show up to the user when creating a new page, but not requiring us to actually delete the templates from the portal.

Definitely coming from an agency perspective here so can understand if the broader use case wouldn't support this.
Thanks for that feedback Josh! cc: <@U22PNRAJD>

<@U26C29XPH> I disagree with the “edge case” mentality — I think it’s actually a very practical feature request. I can’t say for certain (insert HubSpot internal confirmation here) but I would imagine that a significant portion of template , page, and module use comes from agency (and or consultant) work when setting up a HubSpot instance. The client (end user) would greatly benefit from whoever the expert is being able to clean up the portal to be as easy as possible for them to learn and use.
Hey <@U4RP6AGV9> I agree. I typed that and then realized it's really the same use case as what was just implemented for the modules. :slightly_smiling_face:

To also add to this, if there was a checkbox or some way to switch an existing coded template from a Template or Template Partial declaration (ie: the same options when creating a "new file" from the design manager) would be awesome.
I usually develop locally and upload my files through FTP to the portal i'm on and have found that if you upload a coded file that way, it always defaults to a *Template* declaration if it doesn't already exist (even if I intend it to be a Template Partial). 
The only workaround I've found is to create the files through the Design Manager with the setting I intend, and keep the same filename as I intend to upload.
Is there an easy way to setup a path for users to check/revoke GDPR acceptance?

HubSpot change something with the menus? When i click on a link the dropdown gets a `display block` inlined on the child `ul` element. this wasnt happening a day or so ago. Now I have to over ride an inline style.
does the new design manager have a tool to make the css indent and line up nicely?
You can highlight all the code and hit shift tab on mac
<@UB380RRMM> Oh actually that works on the HTML, not sure about the CSS!
that works on pc and on cc. thanks!
Oh it’s alt+tab on PC that minimizes your window, I was afraid you were going to try it on PC, minimize your window and be like, “That Pete guy is an ass”
but double spaces.... :face_with_rolling_eyes:
:point_up:
it this new? when i inspect element, instead of telling me the name of the css file, it says combined-css-cc334ae9347a4be70c1fff1646b29c2a.css
<@UB380RRMM> I get the combined CSS sometimes but not all the time. I’m not sure why.
<@U26DA9CQ0>, I never knew that `shift+tab` would align indents in the DM. An awesome little keyboard shortcut.
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FB8GWFK50/giphy-5.gif|giphy-5.gif>
thanks, it went away shortly after i posted.
